titleStmt.title: By the Lord Deputy General, and General Governor of his Majesties kingdom of Ireland. A declaration Tyrconnel, whereas having been certainly inform'd that the Prince of Orange intends to invade this his Majesties kingdom, who upon the landing of his forces will indeavour to possess himself of all the arms, ammunition and horses ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
Tyrconnel, Richard Talbot, Earl of, 1630-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at His Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"Given at his Majesties castle of Dublin, the 25 day of February ... 1688.".
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
